summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, sent on November 29, 2021, announcing that the jury has been selected for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It provides logistical details for the trial's opening and contains a prosecutorial statement asserting Maxwell's guilt in sexually exploiting underage girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal trial. The prosecutor states she sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable kids.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The author of the email, rallying colleagues to support the trial's opening and expressing confidence in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Jury Selection Completed for Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The email announces that the jury has been selected and preliminary instructions are beginning. The trial is about to start with opening statements.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Reference to Historical Sex Crimes
events.description: The prosecutor references sex crimes that took place in 1994, contrasting the willingness to prosecute such old cases in the Southern District of New York versus Florida.

keyFacts: The jury for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial was selected on November 29, 2021.
The prosecutor asserts that Ghislaine Maxwell sexually exploited underage girls and caused harm to vulnerable children.
The document contrasts the Southern District of New York's willingness to prosecute old sex crime cases (referencing 1994) with an implied reluctance in Florida.
The trial was held at the courthouse at 40 Foley Square, with multiple overflow courtrooms and a dedicated feed for the U.S. Attorney's office.
